description: Take appropriate and proportionate technical operational organizational measures to manage cybersecurity risks. Must implement all 10 measures in Article 21(2)(a)-(j).
verification_method: Security audit on-site inspection documentation review

description: Report significant incidents in 3 stages: Early warning ≤24h Notification ≤72h Final report ≤1 month to CSIRT or competent authority.
Management body approves cybersecurity risk-management measures oversees implementation follows training. Members can be held liable for infringements under Article 20(3).
verification_method: Management body meeting minutes training records
penalty_for_non_compliance: Potential liability of management members administrative fine on entity

obligation_name: Notify Customers of Significant Cyber Threats
verification_method: Communicate to service recipients without undue delay any measures/remedies they can take against significant cyber threats. Inform of threat itself where appropriate.

description: Submit to competent authorities: name address contact details (email IP ranges telephone) sector/subsector Member States where services provided.
Adopt national cybersecurity strategy with objectives governance framework risk assessment preparedness measures public awareness plan. Review every 5 years.

obligation_name: Designate Competent Authorities and Single Point of Contact
description: Designate one or more competent authorities for cybersecurity supervision and single point of contact for cross-border cooperation.
Establish or designate CSIRTs with adequate resources for incident handling vulnerability coordination situational awareness.
Submit to Commission by 17 April 2025 (and annually thereafter): number of essential/important entities per sector/subsector.
Act as trusted intermediary for vulnerability disclosure identify/contact affected entities negotiate disclosure timelines manage multi-party disclosures.
Receive incident notifications provide response ≤24h after early warning provide guidance/support inform other affected Member States where appropriate.
Effectively supervise and ensure compliance with NIS 2. May prioritize based on risk-based approach. Exercise powers per Articles 32/33.
verification_method: Supervision records audit reports inspection logs
